class.name: Inventory
class.brief_description: This node is a stack container.
class.description:
Each stack contains data about amount, [ItemStack](with String item_id from [InventoryDatabase]) and custom properties. Stacks are stored in an Array, which can be accessed with inventory.stacks, but it is best to avoid changing data directly and instead use methods within this node, such as [method add], [method remove], [method set_stack_content], ... The methods correctly call signals when necessary.
Some methods have their general version and a direct version of some [Stack] index, such as [method contains] and [method contains_at].

method.name: add
method.description:
Adds an amount of [ItemStack] to the inventory and returns the amount that cannot be added. [codeblocks] [gdscript] inventory.add("my_item_id", 2) # Add two my_item_id to inventory [/gdscript] [/codeblocks]
There are cases where the inventory may be full or does not accept this item by its category, so the return of this call corresponds to the quantity that was not added (If it returns 0 it means that all items were added correctly) [codeblocks] [gdscript] var unadded_amount = inventory.add("my_item_id", 2) # Add two my_item to inventory if unadded_amount == 0: print("All items added!") else: print(unadded_amount, " items were not added") [/gdscript] [/codeblocks]

method.name: add_at_index
method.description: Adds an amount of [ItemStack](with string id from [InventoryDatabase]) to a specific inventory stack index and returns the amount that cannot be added. [codeblocks] [gdscript] inventory.add_at_index(3, "my_item_id", 2) # Add two my_item to inventory in 3 stack index [/gdscript] [/codeblocks]

method.name: add_on_new_stack
method.description: Add [param item_id] to a new stack, ignoring the possibility of adding that item to an existing stack.

method.name: add_to_stack
method.description: Adds an amount of item_id to the specified stack and returns the amount that cannot be added. [codeblocks] [gdscript] inventory.add_to_stack(stack, "my_item_id", 2) # Add two my_item to inventory in stack [/gdscript] [/codeblocks]

method.name: amount_of_item
method.description: Returns amount of the specified [ItemStack].

method.name: can_add_new_stack
method.description: Returns true if it is possible to add a new stack to the inventory, note that this method consults the configured constraints.

method.name: clear
method.description: Clears the inventory, removing all stacks. [codeblocks] [gdscript] inventory.clear() # Clear inventory [/gdscript] [/codeblocks]

method.name: contains
method.description: Returns true if contains the amount of the specified [ItemStack](with String item_id from [InventoryDatabase]).

method.name: contains_at
method.description: Returns true if the stack index contains the amount of the specified [ItemStack](with String item_id from [InventoryDatabase]).

method.name: contains_category
method.description: Returns true if contains the amount of [ItemStack](with String item_id from [InventoryDatabase]) with the specified [ItemCategory].

method.name: contains_category_in_stack
method.description: Returns true if the stack contains the amount of item (with String item_id from [InventoryDatabase]) with the specified [ItemCategory].

method.name: deserialize
method.description: Deserializes the inventory with a previously serialized dictionary by rewriting the data of this inventory.

method.name: drop
method.description: Drop the specified amount of item(with String item_id from [InventoryDatabase]) from inventory and returns true if it was successful. [codeblocks] [gdscript] inventory.drop("my_item_id", 2) # Drop two my_item_id from inventory [/gdscript] [/codeblocks]

method.name: drop_all_stacks
method.description: Drop all stacks on inventory, [request_drop_item] signal is emitted for each stack.

method.name: drop_from_inventory
method.description: Drop the stack with the specified index. [codeblocks] [gdscript] inventory.drop_from_inventory(0) # Drop stack with index 0 [/gdscript] [/codeblocks]

method.name: get_amount
method.description: Returns amount of items.

method.name: get_amount_of_category
method.description: Returns amount of the specified [ItemCategory].

method.name: get_stack_index_with_an_item_of_category
method.description: Returns the index of the first stack that contains an item of the specified [ItemCategory]. If there is no stack with an item of this category, it returns -1.

method.name: get_weight
method.description: Returns the weight of the inventory. The weight is calculated by summing the weight of all items in the inventory. [codeblocks] [gdscript] var weight = inventory.get_weight() # Get weight of inventory [/gdscript] [/codeblocks]

method.name: has_space_for
method.description: Returns true if the inventory has space for the specified [ItemStack](with String item_id from [InventoryDatabase]). Note: This method check the constraints too.

method.name: has_stack
method.description: Returns true if the inventory has a stack with the specified [ItemStack].

method.name: is_empty
method.description: Returns true if inventory is empty.

method.name: is_full
method.description: Returns true if inventory is full.

method.name: remove
method.description: Removes a amount of the [ItemStack](with String item_id from [InventoryDatabase]) from inventory and returns the amount that was not removed.

method.name: remove_at
method.description: Removes an item_id amount to the specified inventory [ItemStack] index and returns the remaining value that was not removed.

method.name: remove_from_stack
method.description: Remove stack with [param stack] parameter, set [param emit_signal] to false to disable events called by [method update_stack].

method.name: remove_stack
method.description: Removes the stack with the specified index. [codeblocks] [gdscript] inventory.remove_stack(0) # Remove stack with index 0 [/gdscript] [/codeblocks]

method.name: serialize
method.description: Serializes the inventory returning a dictionary with inventory information.

method.name: set_stack_content
method.description: Sets the content of the stack with the specified index. [codeblocks] [gdscript] inventory.set_stack_content(0, "my_item_id", 2) # Set stack with index 0 to my_item_id and amount 2 [/gdscript] [/codeblocks]

method.name: split
method.description: Splits the stack at the specified index and returns true if it was successful. [codeblocks] [gdscript] inventory.split(0, 2) # Split stack with index 0 and amount 2 [/gdscript] [/codeblocks]

method.name: transfer
method.description: Transfer the contents of the stack_index [param stack_index] of this inventory to another inventory ([param destination]). Note: If amount is -1 (default value), the entire contents of the stack are sent to another inventory.

method.name: transfer_at
method.description: Transfer the contents of the stack_index [param stack_index] of this inventory to another stack_index ([param destination_stack_index]) of destination [Inventory]. Note: If amount is -1 (default value), the entire contents of the stack are sent to another inventory.

method.name: update_stack
method.description: Updates the stack with the specified index. This method is called automatically when a stack is added or removed, but it can also be called manually to update the stack. [codeblocks] [gdscript] inventory.update_stack(0) # Update stack with index 0 [/gdscript] [/codeblocks] Note: This method emits the [signal updated_stack] signal.

members.member: Resources that extend [InventoryConstraint] and define rules about inventory additions.
The name of the inventory, to be displayed in UI.
[ItemStack] list, which stores three pieces of information: item_id, amount and dynamic properties of the items.

signal.name: contents_changed
signal.description: Emitted when the contents of the inventory change. This signal is emitted after the [method remove], [method remove_at], [method set_stack_content], [method add], [method add_at] or [method update_stack] function.

signal.name: emptied
signal.description: Emitted when inventory is empty. This signal is emitted after the [method remove], [method remove_at] or [method set_stack_content] function and it only happens when there are no stacks.

signal.name: filled
signal.description: Emitted when inventory is filled. This signal is emitted after the [method add], [method add_at] or [method set_stack_content] function and it only happens when all stacks are filled.

signal.name: request_drop_item
signal.description: Emitted when the [method drop] method is called (Usually called within [method drop_from_inventory] or [method drop_all_stacks]).

signal.name: stack_added
signal.description: Emitted when a new stack is added to the inventory. This signal is emitted after the [method add], [method add_at] or [method add_new_stack] function.

signal.name: stack_removed
signal.description: Emitted when a stack is removed from the inventory. This signal is emitted after the [method remove], [method remove_at] or [method remove_stack] function.

signal.name: updated_stack
signal.description: Emitted when a stack is updated. This signal is emitted after the [method update_stack] function.
